# Test that switching from single file to multiple files works correctly

# First generate with single file mode (default)
muxt generate

exists template_routes.go
! exists index_template_routes_gen.go
! exists about_template_routes_gen.go

# Verify single file contains all routes
grep 'GET /' template_routes.go
grep 'GET /about' template_routes.go

# Switch to multiple files mode
muxt generate --output-multiple-files

# Per-file generated files should now exist
exists index_template_routes_gen.go
exists about_template_routes_gen.go
exists template_routes.go

# Main file should now call per-file functions
grep 'indexTemplateRoutes' template_routes.go
grep 'aboutTemplateRoutes' template_routes.go

exec go test

-- main_test.go --
package main

import (
	"net/http"
	"net/http/httptest"
	"testing"
)

func TestRoutes(t *testing.T) {
	mux := http.NewServeMux()
	s := new(Server)
	TemplateRoutes(mux, s)

	tests := []string{"/", "/about"}
	for _, path := range tests {
		rec := httptest.NewRecorder()
		req := httptest.NewRequest("GET", path, nil)
		mux.ServeHTTP(rec, req)

		if rec.Code != http.StatusOK {
			t.Errorf("path %s: expected 200, got %d", path, rec.Code)
		}
	}
}
